== How to install ==

=== Your current liquid android version is 1.6 (not 2.1) ===

*1)*
Unpack the drivers.

If you have a 32-Bit version of Windows, go to the folder x86, if you have a 64-Bit version, go to the x64 folder.

Then run the setup.exe and follow the instructions.

*2)*
Unpack the Acer A1 Tool.

Run the ACER Download Tool. Click "Browse" and select the downloaded ACER_LiquidE...bin.
Attach your Acer Liquid and press Start. It should start flashing the stock Ã‰clair image.

Don't interrupt this process!!


=== Your current version is android 2.1 or you have just followed the previous chapter ===

*1)*
Unpack the Superboot.zip.

*2)* Reboot you phone is bootloader mode. 

*3)* Run the "Superboot.bat" (windows) or "sh Superboot.sh" (linux)

This will install the root app and a custom recovery and reboot your device.

*4)* Wait until it's booted and then put our latest ROM .zip into the root of the SDCard.

*5)* Reboot in recovery mode.
Double-Click the file "Reboot to recovery.bat" (windows) or lanuch "sh Reboot to recovery.bat" (windows), or use "adb reboot recovery" (both)

Then wait until the device is rebooted into recovery.

*6)* Navigate to "apply any .zip from SD" and push the menu key, and then choose the ROM and press menu again.

Wait for the installation to finish.

Reboot.

Congrats, you're done!

== Factory reset / Data wipe ==

In case of crash while accessing sychronization settings, you need to do a Factory reset.

In case you wipe your data partition (factory reset) you need to reinstall the rom update.zip file. Just apply the zip file in recovery mode.
